dialogues.text: (subtitled, taking umbrage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon Frost. You refuse to speak our  language, you insult the House of  Erebus by using the humans'  gutter-tongue, have you no respect  for tradition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I respect something which  has outlived its purpose? This causes quite a stir amongst the other vampires. Fros well have slapped Dragonetti in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simmering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. And what would you have us do  with this "half-breed"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Study him. Unlock the secrets of his  DNA. He's the key we've been looking  for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is an abomination!  Dragonetti slams his fist down, toppling a carafe, spilli across the tabletop. Frost looks to the others --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should we spend our lives  cringing from the daylight when his  blood offers us an alternative?  Enough talk. It's time we stepped out  of the shadows! Dragonetti looks apoplectic. ELDER PALLINTINE, a five-hun old vampire inhabiting the body of a prepubescent boy, in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of line, Frost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? Or am I just the first to say  out loud what we've all been  thinking?  The fact that no one answers is telling. Dragonetti glowe other Elders, sensing the tide turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadows suit us, Frost. We've  existed this way for thousands of  years. Who are you to challenge our  ways?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone who's sick of living off  scraps. The coming age belongs to us,  not the humans!  (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the final war between our races  comes, who do you want leading the  charge?  Frost stabs an accusing finger at the Overlord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some withered up fossil ready to snap  like a brittle bone at the first sign  of change? Dragonetti GROWLS like an beast, raking his claws across vampire's face, knocking him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!!! Frost picks himself up, touches the gashes on his cheek. fingers, licks the blood from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, old fang. You might wake up  one day and find yourself extinct. Frost smiles at Dragonetti and calmly exits the room.

dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.text: She draws back, instinctively knowing that she's just wit something she shouldn't have. She looks for an exit, SEES doorway. She makes for it --

dialogues.text: filled with swirling blood plasma, choked with electrical biomedical sensors. Karen backpe startled. Its eyes are open now, pupils blown. It snarls, mouthful of razored fangs, trailing mouth-slime across th it futilely tries to chew its way through to Karen. Karen stifles a sob, turning and running right into --

dialogues.speaker: BLADE,
dialogues.text: who now blocks the exit, sword in hand. Karen retreats a wary --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wandered off the beaten path, Doctor? Whistler has entered the room from a second doorway. Kare Whistler to Blade, trapped between them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Abraham Whistler. (re: Blade)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Blade. As for our little  homunculus here -- Whistler limps over to the tank, rapping his cane against creature snaps at it reflexively, following the silver ti forth like a fish after a lure.

dialogues.text: -- he's a vampire.

dialogues.text: You're joking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. You're looking at a prime  specimen of the homines nocturna.  Whistler toys with the feral creature, engaging in a cert of sadistic delight as its efforts grow increasingly more Suddenly, it surges towards the top of the tank, clawing lid -- Karen becomes alarmed -- but then a massive ELECTRICAL JO the creature back into submission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Blade hadn't brought you here, you  would've wound up like him. Karen brings a hand to her bandaged neck, recalling the e previous night. She looks to Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you help me? Blade scowls, his gaze flickering to Whistler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appraising her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. I did some checking, she's  a hematologist. Knowledge like that  might come in handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth the risk. We can't  trust her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're tainted. The venom's  still inside you. You could still  turn on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens then? Blade looks to Whistler -- as far as he's concerned, the over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have to take you out, just  like any other bloodsucker. Blade turns and exits. Whistler and Karen follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the grimy outer windows, we can see that the day i long shadows, amber light. Karen lingers in the doorway, information overload.  Blade begins suiting up for his nightly hunt -- strapping armor, loading ammunition. He strings the tarnished locke neck as if it were an amulet that could ward off evil, th inspect a modified pistol, sighting down the length of it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hunt them, moving from one city to  the next, tracking their migrations.  They're hard to kill. They tend to  regenerate. CLACK! Blade pulls the trigger on an empty chamber, then next weapon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you use, then? A stake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the old wives' tales are true  -- they're severely allergic to  silver, various types of wood. Feed  them garlic and they'll go into  anaphylactic shock --  Whistler picks up a customized rifle with a UV entry ligh on the beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and of course there's always  sunlight, ultra-violet rays.  Karen shakes her head, incredulous --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you honestly expect me to believe  all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you believe. I  saved your life once, I don't plan on  making a habit of it. You want my  advice, you'll be out of the city by  nightfall. If you're stupid enough to  stay, that's your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just leave. I have a life  here, a career --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. You've seen one of them.  You won't be allowed to live after  that.  Karen stares at Blade. Whistler gestures to the windows -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a war going on out there.  Blade, myself, a few others -- we've  tried to keep it from spilling over  onto the streets.  (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes people like yourself get  caught in the cross-fire.  Whistler shrugs. As far as he's concerned, there's nothin say. Karen is still protesting, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can go to the police. I have blood  samples back at the hospital. I can  show them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. You'll be dead before you can  file the complaint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous! No one's that  powerful.  Whistler sighs. He doesn't suffer fools gladly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about a brotherhood  that predates the Catholic Church by  thousands of years. Their survival  depends on their ability to blend in.  Chances are, you've encountered them  and not even known it. On the subway,  in a bar -- Blade slings his CAR-15 onto his shoulder, impatient. He towards the Olds, gesturing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. Youre leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Whistler tosses a small metal canister to Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it a parting gift. Vampire  mace -- silver nitrate, essence of  garlic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it? You guys just patch me  up and send me on my way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one other thing. I'd buy  yourself a gun if I were you. If you  start becoming sensitive to the  daylight, if you start becoming  thirsty regardless of much you've had  to drink -- then I suggest you take  that gun and use it on yourself.  Better that, than the alternative. Karen stares at Whistler, horrified, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are deep in the narrow stacks of a sepulchral archive. what and where this place is will become more clear later But for now, the CAMERA DRIFTS through the warren of aisl the way, we catch a glimpse of a HULKING SILHOUETTE cower series of Japanese shoji screens. Later on, we find --

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: tucked away in a carrel, surrounded by books and scriptur only the SICKLY GLOW of his laptop to provide light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Frost pauses, SEEING Dragonetti emerge from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These archives are restricted to  members of the House of Erebus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. You and the other Elders  wouldn't know what to do with these  texts if your lives depended on it.  (cryptically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which, of course, they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your time, Frost. Far  greater scholars than you have tried  to decipher these words. Whatever  secrets they hold have been lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps. Frost studies Dragonetti, a self-satisfied grin on his fa act was intended to unnerve Dragonetti, it succeeded, tho ancient vampire would never admit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you up to, Frost? Frost shuts the lid on his laptop, rising, drawing intimi close to Dragonetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you like to know, Old Fang? A beat as the young turk stares his elder down. Dragonett first to lose his nerve. Frost smiles and exits, leaving vampire to lick his wounds. CAMERA DRIFTS back to the hulking silhouette, which has b eavesdropping on the conversation. It quivers in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade brings the car to a stop. Karen looks at him. His e hidden behind his glasses, his expression stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what we said. Keep your eyes  open. They're everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Karen crosses the lobby, stepping into an elevator. Just are closing, a WOMAN and TWO MEN duck in alongside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

The woman turns to Ka smiles -- Karen surreptitiously fishes the "vampire mace" from her clutching it -- and now one of the men turns to look at h nodding --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. Karen hurries out, heads left, f in a deserted hallway. She looks back -- -- then skips a heartbeat as the trio also step out! As K the canister of mace -- -- the trio turn and head down to the right. Karen breath relief, shakes her head.

dialogues.text: Karen enters quickly, bolting the door behind her. She pi phone, dials 911 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 Aurora, apartment 3G. Yes, I'll  wait here. Please hurry. Karen hangs up the phone and turns --

dialogues.text: streams in through a window. Karen forces herself to look winces, shielding her eyes. Again, she brings a hand to t wound on her neck. She moves to the window, pulling the s frightened.

dialogues.text: Quinn, his mouth opening wide, saliva dripping from his f pupils pulsating hypnotically. We rush into his gaping ma WHAM! We're back to reality. dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.text: A POLICE OFFICER stands in the hallway -- 30s, handsome, shining armor as far as she's concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Gideon. I'm responding to a  911 call.  Karen visibly relaxes. She opens the door and steps aside Gideon to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that was me, I'm Karen Jansen --  Gideon smiles, takes a quick glance around the room, then Karen's face, the bandages on her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? (off Karen's nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you called, Ms. Jansen, we've  been anxious to get a hold of you. You  disappeared on us for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Listen -- do you have any idea  what happened to Curtis, the other  doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's dead. But I wouldn't worry  about that if I were you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Gideon's smile vanishes as he unholsters his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're dead too. Karen GASPS. She has a half-second to act -- in which she spray of vampire mace into Gideon's face. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garlic?

dialogues.text: He said it would work against  vampires -- Gideon bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said I was a vampire?  Gideon shakes his head, still snickering. He forces Karen wall, placing the gun against her head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the laugh. You can shut  your eyes if you want to. CRASH!!! The front door explodes open as Blade comes flyi it! dialogues.text: You okay? Karen nods, glances at Gideon --

dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured they'd send someone after you.  Thought I'd wait around and see who  showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used me as bait?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked, didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, he could've --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't. Get over it. Blade kneels next to Gideon. He turns the man's head, ins neck, the skin behind the ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's a policeman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a familiar. A human who works for  the vampires. See this mark? Blade pushes aside Gideon's hair, revealing a tiny, crypt tattooed into the man's scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a glyph, kind of like a vampire  cattle brand. That means Officer  Friendly here is someone's property.  Any of the other vampire's try to  bleed him, they'll have to answer to  Friendly's owner -- (studying the glyph)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This glyph belongs to Deacon Frost.  We've been tracking him for a while  now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in God's name would anyone want to  work for them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they're vampire wanna-bes. If  they're loyal, if they prove  themselves, then their masters will  turn them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's a good thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some. Live forever, never get old.  The ultimate high.  Just then, Gideon MOANS. Blade drags the man up so they'r eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mphuck you -- WHAM! Blade plants Gideon's face into the hood of the car GROANS, coughs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preventive medicine. Karen steps in front of Blade, shielding Gideon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this, he's human, it's  murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's war, now get the fuck out of the  way! Karen grabs Blade's arm, wrestling with him, trying to pu away. As the two of them struggle, Gideon makes a break f stumbling across the lawn. Blade pushes Karen aside, take

dialogues.speaker: FIRES --

dialogues.text: God-damnit!!! Do you have any idea  what you just did?! He'll warn them.  They'll be waiting! But Karen's defiant, she's not backing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to kill him. What was I  supposed to do?! Shut my eyes and  pretend I didn't see what I saw?  Blade tears off his glasses. Karen gasps --

dialogues.text: aren't human, nor are they vampire. They're something els green, laced with swirling flecks of red.

Blade slips his glasses back on, leaving Karen shocked in He heads for his Olds without looking back, climbs in, gu engine. In seconds, he's gone, tearing off down the stree of exhaust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY,
dialogues.text: the lupine Gaultier girl from the club, glides beneath th surfacing at the deep end. We SEE --

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: lounging in a chair, studying a laptop which rests beside screen is a digitized image -- a page taken from an ancie manuscript, written in a secret tongue. Officer Gideon waits nearby, cradling his ruined hand, hi face cast downward like a boy who's been called into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you're disappointed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade was waiting for me. There wasn't  anything I could do. Frost nods, lapsing into brooding contemplation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, Gideon, what blood  type are you? Gideon hesitates. Is this a trick question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a wild stab. A? B? O, perhaps?  I'm interested in the antigens here,  the agglutination reaction -- Gideon stammers as Frost rises. In the blink of an eye, F Gideon from the floor, dangling the Officer over the deep pool by his throat --

Mercury is on him in a hear tearing him apart like a Great White consuming a piece of water churns violently around them, clouding with red. dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Blade's Olds cruises to a stop. We're in a low-end commer district -- junky heaven. Blade climbs out, pulling an au rifle from the back seat, then heading into an alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade makes his way down the alley, cautious -- he SEES m trash, boarded-up windows, overlapping layers of gang gra RAT crouching on a trash dumpster, gnawing on a dead pige -- then a SOUND behind Blade, the scuffle of feet --  Blade whirls, drawing his sword, CHARGING at an approachi stopping mere millimeters from decapitating --

dialogues.speaker: KAREN,
dialogues.text: who's been backed up against the wall, her eyes wide with Blade's sword vibrates from the tension in his forearm, h just the slightest taste of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?! I could  have killed you! Blade lowers his sword. Karen remembers to breathe. She s tracing her fingers over the line where her head almost p her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered the address. I followed  you -- Blade shakes his head, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a death wish or are you  just stupid? Karen pushes away from the wall, angry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if what you say is true, if  there's a chance I could turn into one  of them, then I've got no choice, do  I? I have to work with you. I need to  learn everything I can about them.  It's the only way I'll be able to find  a cure for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that. Blade turns and moves to the end of the alley, studying t covered wall intently --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graffiti --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look closer. Blade indicates a design amongst the various gang-banger looks something like a post-modern hieroglyphic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a gang tag, it's a vampire  marking. It means there's a safe-house  nearby.  A place they can go if dawn is coming.  Blade points to a building across the street --

dialogues.speaker: THE HOLLISTON CLINIC,
dialogues.text: your basic inner-city blood-barter establishment where de transients parley their plasma into cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is, time's running out.  His body's starting to reject the  serum. And so far, all my efforts to  find a cure have ended in failure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, Whistler, but you're not  exactly working with state of the art  equipment here. You might have missed  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why you're here. We could use  someone with your experience. A beat passes between them and Karen knows where she stan for a penny, in for a pound. Whistler reaches for Blade's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This used to be mine, you know. It's  been passed down through the  centuries, from one hunter to the  next -- Whistler extends the sword, sighting down the length of i a few practice parries -- it's obvious he used to be quit the art of swordsmanship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you hunt them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Habit, mostly, just like this.  Whistler gestures with his cigarette. He finally stubs it wistful reverie vanishing like so much smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a family once -- a wife, three  daughters. Then a drifter named Deacon  Frost came calling one evening --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually. He toyed with them first.  He made me choose, do you understand?  Which order they would die in -- Karen stares at Whistler, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. He was cruel enough to let  me live. (slapping his brace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even gave me a souvenir to remember  him by. Karen nods -- it's all falling into place for her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you're using Blade to exact  your revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost's bodycount keeps rising, and  I'm not getting any younger, am I? Just then, we hear a SCREAM come from Blade's room, sound like the cry of a beast than a man. Karen takes a step to Blade's room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't go in there if I were you.  It's best to leave him alone when he's  like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen enters. It's dark, just a trace of moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade? No answer. Then Karen SEES him -- crouched in the corner like some kind of nocturnal animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get used to the darkness. Karen takes a step towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler told me about your mother.  Blade clutches the silver locket in his hand. It swings b forth, like a pendulum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't close my eyes without hearing  her scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those aren't real memories. No one has  that kind of recall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. I remember from day one. People  staring at me, sensing I was  different. Watching the fear grow in  their eyes, knowing in their hearts I  wasn't human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not human, then why do you  bleed like us?  I've seen vampire blood, you don't  have it running through your veins. Blade looks at Karen, his lambent eyes glowing in the moo

dialogues.text: Just get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade -- Blade turns, his eyes glowing with preternatural fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, GET OUT!!! Karen backs away, startled by Blade's vehemence. She exit him alone with his demons. He holds up one of his empty s ampoules, crushing it in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: What's all this?

dialogues.text: I made a trip to the hospital last  night, borrowed some equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.text: For your miracle cure?

dialogues.text: She's been making real progress,  Blade. (to Karen)

dialogues.text: Show him -- Karen looks to Blade, who shrugs. She opens a refrigerato a syringe filled with blue fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We've got a good arrangement, that's  all. Whistler makes the weapons, I use  them, the vampires die -- end of  story. Karen finishes. Blade rolls up his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother used to say that a cold  heart is a dead heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother sounds like a Hallmark  greeting card.  Blade slips his Casulls into a shoulder holster, then shr leather jacket, donning his sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd wish you luck, Doc, but I never  put much stock in optimism. He heads towards the elevator.

dialogues.text: How's it going, Kam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: calendar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a week early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the neighborhood. Kam sets his fruit bowl aside, leads Blade through a curt back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kam hands Blade a leather valise. He opens it -- its line ampoules of scarlet-colored serum. Blade pulls one out, h to the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler says I'm building up a  resistance to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid that might happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time to start exploring  other alternatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one alternative to the  serum. Blade nods. They both know what that "alternative" is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. Blade closes the valise and tucks it inside his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Kam. (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One other thing. Have you ever heard  of a vampire called the Sleeper? Kam shakes his head. Blade pulls out the parchment he too Pearl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this in there archives. I need  to find someone who can read their  language.  Kam studies the parchment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard about a woman named  Miracia. Some say she's a mayombero, a  Santeria witch. Supposedly she lives  in that tent community down by the  city dump. I'm told she only sees  people at night.  Blade nods his thanks and heads back through the curtains

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade emerges from the alley into the sunlight, then hear WHISPERED on the wind. VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade. Blade spins, scanning his surroundings -- did he really h name, or was it just the wind? VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade. Again, the taunting voice calls him. Blade's gaze finally on --

dialogues.speaker: A MAN
dialogues.text: sitting on a bench in the deep shade, his face obscured b Chinese newspaper he's reading. There's a LITTLE GIRL sit beside the man -- a look of pure terror written on her fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon, Blade. The man lowers his newspaper. It's Deacon Frost. He's wea sunglasses, but otherwise, he's seemingly unprotected by Blade reaches for his .454 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy. Frost's hand rests on the back of the girl's neck. We see extend, caressing the flesh beneath her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't want our little friend here  to wind up on the back of a milk  carton, would we?  Blade reluctantly lowers his hand. Frost smiles. He takes breath of air, savoring it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful day, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dabble in pharmaceuticals, medical  research. We've developed a type of  sun-blocker using octyl salicylate, a  few others things.  On closer examination we see that Frost is wearing a tran lotion on his face. He touches a finger to his cheek, rub the lotion between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not very effective in direct  sunlight, but it's a start. The goal,  of course, is to be like you, "the  Day-walker".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? The future of our race runs  through your bloodstream. You've got  the best of both worlds, Blade. All of  our strengths and none of our  weaknesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I don't see it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so it's back to pretending we're  human again, is it? Spare me the Uncle  Tom routine. You can't keep denying  what you are. You're one of us, Blade.  You always have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? You think the humans will ever  accept a half-breed like you? They  can't. They're afraid of you.  (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humans fear us because we're  superior. They fear us because in  their hearts they know their race has  become obsolete. Frost watches the marketers stream past, sneering in cont

dialogues.text: Look at them, just an endless stream  of cattle in a mad race to the  slaughterhouse.  Frost lifts a silver flask to his mouth, taking a swig of smacks his lips, sighs contentedly --

dialogues.text: The pause that refreshes -- (offering it to Blade)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care for some? Smells good, doesn't  it? Pungent, with just an  irrepressible hint of iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure now? I bled a newborn for  this. You won't find a drink that's  sweeter.  It takes every ounce of Blade's self-control to keep from Frost -- and Frost senses this, pressing his sharp thumbn the child's jugular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me honestly, do you really get  the same rush from that pasteurized  piss-serum of yours? (off Blade's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're surprised I know about your  serum? You shouldn't be. I know  everything about you.  Frost leans forward, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

If I  were you, I'd take care not to wind up  on the wrong end of the fang. A bead of sweat runs down Frost's neck, washing away a mi of the sun-blocking cream. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love to continue this chat, but it  appears I'm melting. Frost rises, taking the little girl by the hand. Blade fo hand resting on the butt of his Casull.

dialogues.text: (growling)

dialogues.text: Some. It's been slow --

dialogues.text: You don't look so good.

dialogues.text: I'm just tired, that's all. We've been  up all night. Blade nods, not buying her explanation. He shoots a glanc Whistler, which doesn't go unnoticed by Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's start with the basics  -- why do vampires need to drink  blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their own blood can't sustain  hemoglobin.

dialogues.text: Then vampirism is a genetic defect,  just like Hemolytic anemia? Whistler nods.

dialogues.text: So what about gene therapy? Whistler looks intrigued. Karen continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically you'd have to re-write the  victim's DNA, alter it so that the DNA  will produce proteins capable of  generating hemoglobin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.text: With a retrovirus. It's injected into  the bone marrow cells, it causes the  host's DNA to mutate. They've been  using them to treat Sickle-cell  anemia.  Whistler can hardly believe what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious? You actually think  this could work? Karen pauses -- we can see in her expression that there's she's been holding back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On me, yes. On Blade, I'm not so  sure --  (gravely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is, Blade didn't contract  the vampire virus from a bite like I  did. He was born with it. The irony  is, I could probably cure every  vampire but him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we're back to square one, aren't  we? Sooner or later, the Thirst always  wins. At that moment, the lights in the workshop flicker, then Karen looks around the room, alarmed.

dialogues.text: What happened to the power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Is something wrong, my friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me. Blade removes parchment fragment from his jacket and sets table. Miracia traces her fingers over the ancient paper, her fingertips to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sangre. Written in blood.  She runs her hands over each line as if it were written i Some of the candles gutter, then extinguish themselves as around them rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an old tongue, from an old  world. It concerns LaMagra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is LaMagra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampire God. This speaks of His  return. Miracia's fingers search the parchment again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "-- there will come a Day Walker." (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "His blood will call the Sleeper from  beyond the Veil of Tears." Blade stares at Miracia, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blood -- ? The old woman nods, reaching for a smoldering cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Day Walker's blood is a disparador  -- a trigger, you see? For LaMagra's  return. One need only consume it and  the spirit of his ancestors will  settle upon him. (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And the Sleeper will rise from the  shadows anew, cleansing the world in a  Tide of Blood."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recalling the phrase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Blood Tide".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The vampire apocalypse. It is  said that all who feel its taint will  succumb to the Thirst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I stop it? Miracia shrugs, spreading her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Great Wheel turns, my friend. The  Dark is rising. How would you fight a  shadow?  Miracia sits back, slumping into her chair. The candles h themselves down to nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am tired. Dawn is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just got here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been here longer than you  think.  Blade rises, looking to the horizon. Incredibly, dawn is he stands there, mystified, the wind picks up, sweeping t fragment out of his hand. He tries to snatch it back, but fragment is quickly borne away. He watches it disappear i then turns back -- Miracia is gone. Blade glances around him, but she's nowh found.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PULLS BACK,
dialogues.text: isolating Blade amidst the ghostly squalor. From our vant he looks like any other homeless phantom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade steps out from the elevator into the workshop -- The place has been trashed. It looks like a tornado touch his absence. Blade pulls out one of his .454s, cautious -

dialogues.speaker: WHISTLER
dialogues.text: -- and then he stops dead in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: WHISTLER
dialogues.text: has been strung up by his arms against the far wall, tort left for dead. In response to Blade's voice, a MOAN escap man's lips. Blade rushes to the wall, cutting Whistler down with his gently lowering him to the floor. As he cradles the old m arms, Blade sees the primary wound -- two ragged puncture Whistler's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Whistler, what did they do to  you? Whistler opens his eyes, struggling to speak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost took her -- Whistler spasms and coughs, wincing from the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to talk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. You have to -- finish me off.  You don't want me coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we can treat the wounds -- But Whistler is shaking his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too far gone, you know that. Blade's at a complete loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler, I can't. Whistler clutches at Blade's arm, his eyes burning with c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can. Now get on with it.  As much as he'd like to deny it, Blade knows that Whistle He pulls a stake from his bandoleer, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off, more gentle now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  (forcing a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be quick about it, will you? Do  it right. Blade fights back tears. With a wretched moan, he turns h drives the stake into Whistler's chest. Whistler GASPS. B his arms around the older man, holding him tight as the l of him, rocking back and forth -- After a while, the rocking stops and Blade lays Whistler floor. Then something catches his eye --

dialogues.speaker: A SHARP VIEW-CAMCORDER
dialogues.text: resting nearby, labeled, "PLAY ME". Blade reaches for the cues the tape -- Frost's face appears on the tiny built-i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Blade. By the time you watch  this, Whistler will no doubt be  winging his way to Heaven, thanks to  your capable hands. If it makes any  difference to you, he put up quite a  fight. Frost touches a deep gash which runs across his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I'm sure you're wondering about  Ms. Jansen's well-being. She's alive  and kicking -- "ambulatory", as they  like to say in the trade. Whether or  not she remains so is entirely up to  you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make this as easy as possible for  you, Blade. You can find us at the  Edgewood Towers. We'll be waiting with  baited breath. The tape cuts to static. Blade throws the camcorder again It shatters into a dozen pieces. Blade turns now, his eyes falling on the medical equipmen brought from the hospital. He moves to the refrigerator, canister labeled "SODIUM CITRATE". Then he draws his swor practically see the wheels turning within his mind --

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER,
dialogues.text: Blade stands before the open flames of one of the furnace his sword in the fire. He withdraws it -- it's molten red Blade turns, dousing the molten hot sword into the sodium canister. The refrigerated liquid reacts with the heat, c sword to STEAM and HISS. When Blade withdraws the smoking sword, we SEE that the g steel has changed colors, taking on a bluish tinge, just sodium citrate it was immersed in. Blade smiles to himsel satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparse decor in a Neo-Japanese vein. Minimalist lighting. are glass. Recirculating pumps send a constant stream of cascading down them. Karen is escorted into the room by Mercury. She gestures at the end of a long table. Karen sits.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: leans forward out of the shadows, resting his elbows on t hands steepled together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here we are, Doctor. A cigarette appears in Frost's hand. In the blink of an e cigarette is lit, burning. The movements are so quick we time to register them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you killed me yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon likes to play with his food  before he eats it. Frost laughs. Karen tries to keep calm. The longer she ke talking, the longer she remains alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many of you are there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few thousand scattered about the  globe. In the past, we've had to  restrict our numbers for fear of  discovery. That won't be necessary  after tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blood Tide. Our long-prophesied  holy war against the humans. There's a  force, you see -- a spirit that exists  in our blood. I've discovered a way to  invoke it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaMagra --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. The answers were there  all along, of course, scribbled down  in the forgotten languages of my kind.  Waiting for someone with the patience  to decipher them.  My elders were foolish enough to  dismiss them as wives tales. But I  knew better.  (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine my surprise when Blade turned  out to be the key which would set that  force free.  Frost sits forward now, impassioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaMagra isn't a physical being. He's a  spirit, requiring a flesh and blood  host in order to manifest himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who better to usher in the Blood Tide?  Karen shakes her head, protesting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need for any of this. Your  condition can be treated. Whistler and  I were working on a cure when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think we want to be  cured? Blood is only part of the  equation. The hunt, the killing,  that's what the Thirst is really  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you use blood banks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only as a last resort. Preserved blood  is inferior. There's no flavor left to  it, no life.  (rising from his seat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately, I've found a way around  that particular obstacle.  Frost moves to the end of the room. He pushes a button. W the wall slides open, revealing something Karen wishes sh seen -- living blood banks.

dialogues.speaker: THREE SEDATED HUMANS
dialogues.text: have been hooked up to IV feeds which replenish various n their blood is drained from them. Shunts have been implan forearms which serve as taps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under these conditions I can keep a  donor alive for years, producing  anywhere from fifty to a hundred pints  of blood. (admiring his charges)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, this is just a pilot  program, really. Once the Tide comes,  we'll need to expand production. So  many more mouths to feed --  Karen turns away, overwhelmed by revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because we live at another  species' expense? Your people farm  cattle and veal, don't they? Fattening  them up with steroids? It's called  evolution, Doctor. Survival of the  fittest.  Frost stares at Karen with an intense, uncompromising gaz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a wake-up call for the human  race. You're no longer at the top of  the food chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A telephoto view of Frost's penthouse. The windows are po blocking out the sun's harsh rays. Blade lowers a pair of binoculars. He's standing on the r building across the street. He hefts an air-launcher rifl firing position -- BANG! An iron spike trailing a steel cable rockets throug between the two buildings, sinking into the concrete faca Frost's penthouse. Blade secures his end of the rope. He pulley over the rope, grabs hold of two handles, and leap roof ledge! WHOOSH! Blade slides towards Frost's penthouse, a good tw above street level. A second before he reaches the window lets go. Momentum sends him CRASHING through in a shower

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM is ringing. Sunlight streams in through the brok TWO VAMPIRE GUARDS who have been caught in the sudden swa are burning up before our eyes. Blade climbs to his feet

dialogues.speaker: A THIRD VAMPIRE
dialogues.text: leaps at him. Blade spins, flipping the vampire over his sending him straight through one of the other windows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampire tumbles earthward, SCREAMING as the sun's ray body, falling like a human comet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade unsheathes his sword and heads out into the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Blade's right is the inner chamber with the "waterfall ANOTHER VAMPIRE approaches, Blade readies his sword --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm afraid of that toothpick  of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be. I've made some  improvements. And with that, Blade thrusts his blackened sword forward, through the vampire's chest.  The creature SHRIEKS and atomizes -FWOOSH!- flying apart beaded spray of blood mist.  Up ahead are a set of steel doors with a time-lock mechan draws a Casull, BLASTS away at the lock, then shoulders t open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in a windowless, vault-like room dominated by a se high-tech STAINLESS STEEL SARCOPHAGI. Think of a hyperbar each unit possessing a small face-plate window through wh sleeping subject can be viewed. Blade unsheathes his sword. He grabs the lid of the first sarcophagus, HEAVING upward. With a PNEUMATIC HISS, the l belching out a cloud of condensation mist.  As the mist clears, revealing the occupant within, Blade sword, ready to plunge it downward -- only it's not Deaco rests beneath him, it's --

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA,
dialogues.text: Blade's mother!!! Although some thirty years have passed events of our prologue, Vanessa looks exactly the same -- beautiful, full of life. Her eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason.  Blade gasps, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother -- ?! Vanessa rises from the sarcophagus, tears staining her ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you so much, Jason.  (drawing closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I've been  through, how much I've wanted to see  you --  Blade falters, his mind reeling. What he's seeing is inco -- his mother is dead. Yet, here she is in the flesh, rea him and -- -- flashing a mouthful of viper-like fangs! She SNARLS an brutally raking her claws across Blade's face, knocking t from his grasp --

dialogues.speaker: A TRIO OF BLACK-CLAD VAMPIRES
dialogues.text: led by Mercury step from the shadows where they'd been wa along. They're armed with tasers which they fire en masse Blade is hit by the taser darts from all sides. He writhe electricity courses through him, then collapses in a heap to lift his head, looking up at Vanessa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you -- died --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hellish smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon brought me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight him -- As if on cue, Frost appears at Vanessa's side, wrapping a arm about her waist, kissing the nape of her neck. She le -- an act of practiced intimacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't. She's one of my thralls  now. She has about as much free will  as a puppet on a string. (looking at Vanessa)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love me, don't you, Vanessa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Frost kisses Vanessa hungrily. Then he kneels and reaches Blade's jacket, retrieving a vial of Blade's serum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have here? Your precious  serum? I don't think you'll be needing  this anymore. Frost crushes the vial in his fist. Blade struggles to re stretching a palsied hand upwards --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to your father, Jason. It's  going to be a better world. Blade stares at Vanessa uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look so surprised, Blade. You've  spent your life looking for the  vampire who fathered you. Well you can  rest easy now, you've found him. (gripping Blade's chin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's here. Blade's eyes widen in shock. Frost simply laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, Blade. You've got my blood  running through your veins. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty years ago. A moonlit street, a  woman on her way home alone. You were  conceived the night I tore my fangs  into your mother's flesh.  Frost swings his fist into Blade's skull. Everything goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN as Blade opens his eyes, still groggy, his face b sweat. Feverish. His hands have been bound tightly behind with manacles and chains.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: sits nearby, watching him. From the steady rocking motion SOUNDS of traffic outside, it's evident that they are in a moving truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been better --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have we been driving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I woke up just before  you did -- As he struggles to sit up, she crosses over to him. Blade eyes for a moment, fighting a wave of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get out of this alive, maybe I'll  take that miracle cure of yours. Karen doesn't respond. Instead she looks away. How in the she supposed to tell him this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Karen forces herself to meet his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your condition's congenital, the  genetic mutations occurred in utero.  All the other victims contracted  vampirism after birth.  Blade stares at Karen, disbelieving. Who could imagine a horrifying irony? She's crying now. She can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't cure you, Blade. I can cure  myself, but I can't cure you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Blade's head sinks, the last vestiges of hope draining ou And then, as if the final stake were being pounded in, th lurches to a stop. We hear the ENGINE being killed, then approaching, and then a series of BOLTS BEING SHIFTED as -- the back of the truck is thrown open. Frost stands the grinning, flanked by Mercury, Quinn, Vanessa, and a half-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and Karen are dragged from the back of the truck, w revealed now to be an armored car.

dialogues.speaker: THE BANK OF EREBUS
dialogues.text: rises up before them. A towering beaux-arts edifice situa heart of the city's high-priced financial district -- one institutions owned and operated by the vampire enclave. Frost starts up the marble steps towards a grand, triple- entrance flanked by Corinthian columns. Karen and Blade a along after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost leads his vampires into a high-ceilinged atrium, mo a bank of elevators -- one of the doors of which is outfi high-tech hand-key ID system. Frost places his palm on the ID screen. The screen GLOWS acknowledging his identity. In response, the doors HISS o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and Karen are pulled inside the elevator. The contr buttons have vampire glyphs, rather than numbers. Frost p bottom one. The doors close with a WHOOSH and the car des down, down, down. Frost glances over at Karen, smiling amiably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On its surface, this building houses  one of the city's oldest financial  institutions -- and for over  two-hundred years its served our  corporate needs. Look beneath the  surface, however, and you'll discover  another truth entirely -- The elevator CHIMES, having arrived at its destination. T HISS open, revealing

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE TEMPLE OF NIGHT
dialogues.text: A vast, barrel-vaulted chamber lined with recessed tombs out before us -- an underground cathedral of sorts, wroug alabaster and marble. Restrained. Elegant. Replete with d splendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As above, so below. Torches burn in wall sconces, casting everything in a war glow. Frost takes in the beauty of the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to our hall of ancients,  Doctor. We call it the Temple of  Night. Blade and Karen are led to the middle of the room, where altar rises up from a dais. Blade is roughly thrown to th kneels there, eyes cast downward. Broken. His system bein by the devastating effects of the Thirst.  Quinn and Mercury pick their way through Blade's discarde Quinn picks up the punching dagger, admiring it.  Frost turns to Mercury, who's been holding Blade's scabba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see this sword of his. Mercury draws the sword, handing it to Frost. He sights d length of it, testing its weight. With a flick of his wri lashes out, slashing Blade's cheek open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still quite sharp, I see. Blade feebly struggles to rise. Frost clubs him on the ba neck with the sword pommel. Blade crumples. Karen tries t but Quinn holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your breath, woman. He  can't hear you now. It's the Thirst,  you see? It already has him in its  grip. Frost reaches down, dragging Blade's head up by his hair. watches on as Frost continues to taunt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has it been since you had  your serum? Twelve hours? More? You  must be quite thirsty by now. He crouches down so he's eye to eye with Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it feel like? Is your blood  on fire? Are you burning up inside?  Give in to the Thirst, Blade. Embrace  your true nature. Blade shivers, grits his teeth, it's like he's going thro withdrawal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- go to hell -- Frost smiles, his eyes burning with an infernal glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got news for you, Blade. We're  already here. Frost turns to the others, motioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him to the sanctuary. It's time  he was bled. The other vampires retreat, dragging Blade along with the left alone with Frost and Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd let you watch the proceedings,  Doctor, but I'm afraid that privilege  is reserved for members of my own  race. Don't worry, though, I've made  alternate arrangements for you. Frost motions and Quinn drags Karen towards --

dialogues.speaker: THE MOUTH OF A PIT
dialogues.text: some forty feet deep, its lichen-encrusted stone walls wo over time. As Frost gestures to the yawning darkness bene Quinn forces Karen towards the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call this the Bone Pit. It's where  we keep our mistakes, the ones who  couldn't successfully make the  transition from human to vampire.  Frost reaches out, caressing Karen's neck, puncturing the beneath her chin with a razored fingernail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll feed on anything, given the  chance -- animals, corpses, even other  vampires. Frost nods. Karen struggles against Quinn, but it's no go manner of seconds, she's falling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- making a decidedly rough landing on a heap of bones fa GROANS, taking stock of her battered body.

dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE,
dialogues.text: Deacon watches from the lip of the pit, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, a strapping young woman  like yourself -- well I think you just  might be considered finger food. And with that, he's gone, stepping away from the pit.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TEMPLE OF NIGHT
dialogues.text: We are in a small, elevated antechamber which is situated main vampire sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: BLADE,
dialogues.text: now weakened to the point of collapse, is being lashed to device by iron chains.  Mercury and her cohorts move efficiently, quickly securin they are through, the rack is hoisted up into the air via winch-driven chains.  With every turn of the winch crank, the chains are drawn causing Blade to CRY OUT, until at last, he is suspended spread-eagle.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: approaches, still carrying Blade's sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long road, hasn't it? Such  a pity Whistler led you so far astray.  Frost cocks his head to the side, studying Blade's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame you, though. I want you  to know that. Even after all you've  done. I understand, Blade, I really  do. It's the human side of you which  has corrupted your reasoning, made you  weak. But we'll take care of that,  won't we? Blade struggles to lift his head, forcing himself to matc gaze, shaking with hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd kill myself -- before I turned  into something like you. Frost just smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you wouldn't. I'm going to bleed  you dry, Blade. All the poison that  makes you human.  (drawing closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Tide comes, you'll be begging  me put you through the Change.  Frost lifts up Blade's sword, methodically slitting Blade one by one. He makes the cuts lengthwise, opening up the basilic veins with surgical precision. Blood wells up from the fresh wounds, running down Blade' collecting in a cistern beneath his feet.  Frost watches the steady, inexorable process, then nods, He looks to the others who are gathered behind him, watch silent reverence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. We should ready ourselves  for the ritual of invocation. Frost leads Mercury, Quinn, and the others from the sanct Blade struggles futilely against his bonds, crying out in frustration, his body eventually sagging from exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no use fighting us, Jason.  Blade looks up, focusing now on --

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA,
dialogues.text: who has remained behind. Blade stares at her. As terrible physical torment is, his mother's betrayal is infinitely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you be a part of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are my people now. I'm one of  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. I've killed,  I've hunted, and I've enjoyed it.  She draws closer, caressing her son's face. There's just creepy eroticism in her action, a dash of incest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you could see the world as I  do. Deacon opened my eyes. There's no  turning back from that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will. Time is on our side. Sooner  or later, the Thirst always wins. Vanessa turns away now. Blade cries after her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother! Vanessa pauses, looking back, smiling cruelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother died the night you were born.  And with that, she's gone, melting into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen rises, wary, taking in her shadowed surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: HEAPS OF HUMAN BONES
dialogues.text: are piled against the pit walls -- skulls, rib-cages, fem -- all picked clean of flesh. Some of the skulls have lar like fangs -- the remnants, no doubt, of long-deceased va Suddenly we hear a WHISPER of sorts, the soft CLINKING of fragments grinding together -- Karen spins, trying to place the source of the sound. The the SOUND again. Behind her now, closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karennnnn -- Karen looks up with a growing sense of dread.

dialogues.speaker: A FACE
dialogues.text: emerges from the darkness. Pallid, cadaverous, shedding i desiccated flesh. Lidless eyes like black marbles slick w Vaseline. A mouth like a raw wound.
